P110120.label: PPG, bilateral concessional (AMT, current US$)
P110120.description: Bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110121.label: IMF repurchases (AMT, current US$)
P110121.description: IMF repurchases are total repayments of outstanding drawings from the General Resources Account during the year specified, excluding repayments due in the reserve tranche. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110122.label: Principal repayments on external debt, long-term + IMF (AMT, current US$)
P110122.description: Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. This item includes principal repayments on long-term debt and IMF repurchases. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. IMF repurchases are total repayments of outstanding drawings from the General Resources Account during the year specified, excluding repayments due in the reserve tranche. To maintain comparability between data on transactions with the IMF and data on long-term debt, use of IMF credit outstanding at the end of year (stock) is converted to dollars at the SDR exchange rate in effect at the end of year. Repurchases (flows) are converted at the average SDR exchange rate for the year in which transactions take place. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110123.label: Principal repayments on external debt, long-term (AMT, current US$)
P110123.description: Principal repayments on long-term debt are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110124.label: Principal repayments on external debt, private nonguaranteed (PNG) (AMT, current US$)
P110124.description: Private nonguaranteed external debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is not guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110125.label: Principal repayments on external debt, public and publicly guaranteed (PPG) (AMT, current US$)
P110125.description: Public and publicly guaranteed long-term debt are aggregated. Public debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110126.label: PPG, IBRD (AMT, current US$)
P110126.description: Public and publicly guaranteed debt outstanding from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) is nonconcessional. Nonconcessional debt excludes loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110127.label: PPG, IDA (AMT, current US$)
P110127.description: Public and publicly guaranteed debt outstanding from the International Development Association (IDA) is concessional. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110128.label: PPG, multilateral (AMT, current US$)
P110128.description: Public and publicly guaranteed multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110129.label: PPG, multilateral concessional (AMT, current US$)
P110129.description: Public and publicly guaranteed multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110130.label: PPG, official creditors (AMT, current US$)
P110130.description: Public and publicly guaranteed debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110131.label: PPG, bonds (AMT, current US$)
P110131.description: Public and publicly guaranteed debt from bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110132.label: PPG, commercial banks (AMT, current US$)
P110132.description: Public and publicly guaranteed commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110133.label: PNG, bonds (AMT, current US$)
P110133.description: Nonguaranteed long-term debt from bonds that are privately placed. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110134.label: PNG, commercial banks and other creditors (AMT, current US$)
P110134.description: Nonguaranteed long-term commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110135.label: PPG, other private creditors (AMT, current US$)
P110135.description: Public and publicly guaranteed other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110136.label: PPG, private creditors (AMT, current US$)
P110136.description: Public and publicly guaranteed debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110137.label: Principal arrears, long-term DOD (US$)
P110137.description: Principal in arrears on long-term debt is defined as principal repayment due but not paid, on a cumulative basis. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110138.label: Principal arrears, official creditors (current US$)
P110138.description: Principal in arrears on long-term debt is defined as principal repayment due but not paid, on a cumulative basis. Debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110139.label: Principal arrears, private creditors (current US$)
P110139.description: Principal in arrears on long-term debt is defined as principal repayment due but not paid, on a cumulative basis. Debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110140.label: Principal forgiven (current US$)
P110140.description: Principal forgiven is the amount of principal due or in arrears that was written off or forgiven in any given year. It includes debt forgiven within and outside Paris Club agreements, principal forgiven and principal arrears forgiven. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110141.label: Principal rescheduled (current US$)
P110141.description: Principal rescheduled is the amount of principal due or in arrears that was rescheduled in any given year. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110142.label: Principal rescheduled, official (current US$)
P110142.description: Principal rescheduled is the amount of principal due or in arrears that was rescheduled in any given year. Debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110143.label: Principal rescheduled, private (current US$)
P110143.description: Principal rescheduled is the amount of principal due or in arrears that was rescheduled in any given year. Debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110144.label: Commitments, public and publicly guaranteed (COM, current US$)
P110144.description: Commitments are the total amount of long-term loans for which contracts were signed in the year specified; data for private nonguaranteed debt are not available. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110145.label: Commitments, IBRD (COM, current US$)
P110145.description: Commitments (IBRD) are the sum of new commitments on public and publicly guaranteed loans from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD). Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110146.label: Commitments, IDA (COM, current US$)
P110146.description: Commitments (IDA) are the sum of new commitments on public and publicly guaranteed loans from the International Development Association (IDA). Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110147.label: Commitments, official creditors (COM, current US$)
P110147.description: Commitments are the amount of long-term loans for which contracts were signed in the year specified. Debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110148.label: Commitments, private creditors (COM, current US$)
P110148.description: Commitments are the amount of long-term loans for which contracts were signed in the year specified; data for private nonguaranteed debt are not available. Debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110149.label: Currency composition of PPG debt, Deutsche mark (%)
P110149.description: The percentage of external long-term public and publicly-guaranteed debt contracted in Deutsche marks for the low- and middle-income countries.

P110150.label: Currency composition of PPG debt, Euro (%)
P110150.description: The percentage of external long-term public and publicly-guaranteed debt contracted in Euros for the low- and middle-income countries.

P110151.label: Currency composition of PPG debt, French franc (%)
P110151.description: The percentage of external long-term public and publicly-guaranteed debt contracted in French francs for the low- and middle-income countries.

P110152.label: Currency composition of PPG debt, Japanese yen (%)
P110152.description: The percentage of external long-term public and publicly-guaranteed debt contracted in Japanese yen for the low- and middle-income countries.

P110153.label: Currency composition of PPG debt, Multiple currencies (%)
P110153.description: The percentage of external long-term public and publicly-guaranteed debt contracted in multiple currencies for the low- and middle-income countries.

P110154.label: Currency composition of PPG debt, all other currencies (%)
P110154.description: The percentage of external long-term public and publicly-guaranteed debt contracted in all other currencies not specified for the low- and middle-income countries.

P110155.label: Currency composition of PPG debt, SDR (%)
P110155.description: The percentage of external long-term public and publicly-guaranteed debt contracted in special drawing rights for the low- and middle-income countries.

P110156.label: Currency composition of PPG debt, Swiss franc (%)
P110156.description: The percentage of external long-term public and publicly-guaranteed debt contracted in Swiss francs for the low- and middle-income countries.

P110157.label: Currency composition of PPG debt, Pound sterling (%)
P110157.description: The percentage of external long-term public and publicly-guaranteed debt contracted in U.K. pound sterling for the low- and middle-income countries.

P110158.label: Currency composition of PPG debt, U.S. dollars (%)
P110158.description: The percentage of external long-term public and publicly-guaranteed debt contracted in U.S. dollars for the low- and middle-income countries.

P110159.label: Debt forgiveness or reduction (current US$)
P110159.description: Debt forgiveness or reduction shows the change in debt stock due to debt forgiveness or reduction. It is derived by subtracting debt forgiven and debt stock reduction from debt buyback. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110160.label: PPG, bilateral (DIS, current US$)
P110160.description: Bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110161.label: PPG, bilateral concessional (DIS, current US$)
P110161.description: Bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110162.label: IMF purchases (DIS, current US$)
P110162.description: IMF purchases are total drawings on the General Resources Account of the IMF during the year specified, excluding drawings in the reserve tranche. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110163.label: Disbursements on external debt, long-term + IMF (DIS, current US$)
P110163.description: Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. This item includes disbursements on long-term debt and IMF purchases. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. IMF purchases are total drawings on the General Resources Account of the IMF during the year specified, excluding drawings in the reserve tranche. To maintain comparability between data on transactions with the IMF and data on long-term debt, use of IMF credit outstanding at the end of year (stock) is converted to dollars at the SDR exchange rate in effect at the end of year. Purchases are converted at the average SDR exchange rate for the year in which transactions take place. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110164.label: Disbursements on external debt, long-term (DIS, current US$)
P110164.description: Disbursements on long-term debt are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110165.label: Disbursements on external debt, private nonguaranteed (PNG) (DIS, current US$)
P110165.description: Private nonguaranteed external debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is not guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110166.label: Disbursements on external debt, public and publicly guaranteed (PPG) (DIS, current US$)
P110166.description: Public and publicly guaranteed long-term debt are aggregated. Public debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110167.label: IDA grants (current US$)
P110167.description: IDA grants are net disbursements of grants from the International Development Association (IDA). Data are in current U.S. dollars. Regional allocations are included in aggregate data.

P110168.label: PPG, IBRD (DIS, current US$)
P110168.description: Public and publicly guaranteed debt outstanding from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) is nonconcessional. Nonconcessional debt excludes loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110169.label: PPG, IDA (DIS, current US$)
P110169.description: Public and publicly guaranteed debt outstanding from the International Development Association (IDA) is concessional. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110170.label: PPG, multilateral (DIS, current US$)
P110170.description: Public and publicly guaranteed multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110171.label: PPG, multilateral concessional (DIS, current US$)
P110171.description: Public and publicly guaranteed multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110172.label: PPG, official creditors (DIS, current US$)
P110172.description: Public and publicly guaranteed debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110173.label: PPG, bonds (DIS, current US$)
P110173.description: Public and publicly guaranteed debt from bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110174.label: PPG, commercial banks (DIS, current US$)
P110174.description: Public and publicly guaranteed commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110175.label: PNG, bonds (DIS, current US$)
P110175.description: Nonguaranteed long-term debt from bonds that are privately placed. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110176.label: PNG, commercial banks and other creditors (DIS, current US$)
P110176.description: Nonguaranteed long-term commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110177.label: PPG, other private creditors (DIS, current US$)
P110177.description: Public and publicly guaranteed other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110178.label: PPG, private creditors (DIS, current US$)
P110178.description: Public and publicly guaranteed debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110179.label: External debt stocks, concessional (DOD, current US$)
P110179.description: Concessional external debt conveys information about the borrower's receipt of aid from official lenders at concessional terms as defined by the Development Assistance Committee (DAC) of the OECD. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Loans from major regional development banks--African Development Bank, Asian Development Bank, and the Inter-American Development Bank--and from the World Bank are classified as concessional according to each institution's classification and not according to the DAC definition, as was the practice in earlier reports. Long-term debt outstanding and disbursed is the total outstanding long-term debt at year end. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110180.label: Concessional debt (% of total external debt)
P110180.description: Concessional debt to total external debt stocks. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more.

P110181.label: PPG, bilateral (DOD, current US$)
P110181.description: Public and publicly guaranteed bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110182.label: PPG, bilateral concessional (DOD, current US$)
P110182.description: Public and publicly guaranteed bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110183.label: External debt stocks, total (DOD, current US$)
P110183.description: Total external debt is debt owed to nonresidents repayable in currency, goods, or services. Total external debt is the sum of public, publicly guaranteed, and private nonguaranteed long-term debt, use of IMF credit, and short-term debt. Short-term debt includes all debt having an original maturity of one year or less and interest in arrears on long-term debt. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110184.label: Total change in external debt stocks (current US$)
P110184.description: Total change in debt stocks shows the variation in debt stock between two consecutive years. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110185.label: External debt stocks (% of exports of goods, services and primary income)
P110185.description: Total external debt stocks to exports of goods, services and primary income.

P110186.label: External debt stocks (% of GNI)
P110186.description: Total external debt stocks to gross national income. Total external debt is debt owed to nonresidents repayable in currency, goods, or services. Total external debt is the sum of public, publicly guaranteed, and private nonguaranteed long-term debt, use of IMF credit, and short-term debt. Short-term debt includes all debt having an original maturity of one year or less and interest in arrears on long-term debt. GNI (formerly GNP) is the sum of value added by all resident producers plus any product taxes (less subsidies) not included in the valuation of output plus net receipts of primary income (compensation of employees and property income) from abroad.

P110187.label: Use of IMF credit (DOD, current US$)
P110187.description: Use of IMF Credit: Data related to the operations of the IMF are provided by the IMF Treasurer s Department. They are converted from special drawing rights into dollars using end-of-period exchange rates for stocks and average-over-the-period exchange rates for flows. IMF trust fund operations under the Enhanced Structural Adjustment Facility, Extended Fund Facility, Poverty Reduction and Growth Facility, and Structural Adjustment Facility (Enhanced Structural Adjustment Facility in 1999) are presented together with all of the IMF s special facilities (buffer stock, supplemental reserve, compensatory and contingency facilities, oil facilities, and other facilities). SDR allocations are also included in this category. According to the BPM6, SDR allocations are recorded as the incurrence of a debt liability of the member receiving them (because of a requirement to repay the allocation in certain circumstances, and also because interest accrues). This debt item is introduced for the first time this year with historical data starting in 1999.

P110188.label: External debt stocks, long-term (DOD, current US$)
P110188.description: Long-term debt is debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year. It has three components: public, publicly guaranteed, and private nonguaranteed debt. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110189.label: External debt stocks, private nonguaranteed (PNG) (DOD, current US$)
P110189.description: Private nonguaranteed external debt comprises long-term external obligations of private debtors that are not guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110190.label: External debt stocks, public and publicly guaranteed (PPG) (DOD, current US$)
P110190.description: Public and publicly guaranteed debt comprises long-term external obligations of public debtors, including the national government, political subdivisions (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies, and external obligations of private debtors that are guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110191.label: External debt stocks, short-term (DOD, current US$)
P110191.description: Short-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original maturity of one year or less. Available data permit no distinction between public and private nonguaranteed short-term debt. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110192.label: Short-term debt (% of total reserves)
P110192.description: Short-term debt includes all debt having an original maturity of one year or less and interest in arrears on long-term debt. Total reserves includes gold.

P110193.label: Short-term debt (% of exports of goods, services and primary income)
P110193.description: Short-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original maturity of one year or less. Available data permit no distinction between public and private nonguaranteed short-term debt.

P110194.label: Short-term debt (% of total external debt)
P110194.description: Short-term debt includes all debt having an original maturity of one year or less and interest in arrears on long-term debt. Total external debt is debt owed to nonresidents repayable in currency, goods, or services. Total external debt is the sum of public, publicly guaranteed, and private nonguaranteed long-term debt, use of IMF credit, and short-term debt.

P110195.label: Debt forgiveness grants (current US$)
P110195.description: Debt forgiveness grants data cover both debt cancelled by agreement between debtor and creditor and a reduction in the net present value of non-ODA debt achieved by concessional rescheduling or refinancing. The  data are on a disbursement basis and cover flows from all bilateral and multilateral donors. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110196.label: PPG, IBRD (DOD, current US$)
P110196.description: Public and publicly guaranteed debt outstanding from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) is nonconcessional. Nonconcessional debt excludes loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110197.label: PPG, IDA (DOD, current US$)
P110197.description: Public and publicly guaranteed debt outstanding from the International Development Association (IDA) is concessional. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110198.label: PPG, multilateral (DOD, current US$)
P110198.description: Public and publicly guaranteed multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110199.label: Multilateral debt (% of total external debt)
P110199.description: Multilateral debt to total external debt stocks.

P110200.label: PPG, multilateral concessional (DOD, current US$)
P110200.description: Public and publicly guaranteed multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110201.label: IBRD loans and IDA credits (DOD, current US$)
P110201.description: IBRD loans and IDA credits are public and publicly guaranteed debt extended by the World Bank Group. The International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) lends at market rates. Credits from the International Development Association (IDA) are at concessional rates. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110202.label: PPG, official creditors (DOD, current US$)
P110202.description: Public and publicly guaranteed debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110203.label: PPG, bonds (DOD, current US$)
P110203.description: Public and publicly guaranteed debt from bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110204.label: PPG, commercial banks (DOD, current US$)
P110204.description: Public and publicly guaranteed commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110205.label: PNG, bonds (DOD, current US$)
P110205.description: Nonguaranteed long-term debt from bonds that are privately placed. Private nonguaranteed long-term debt outstanding and disbursed is an external obligation of a private debtor that is not guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110206.label: PNG, commercial banks and other creditors (DOD, current US$)
P110206.description: Nonguaranteed long-term commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Private nonguaranteed long-term debt outstanding and disbursed is an external obligation of a private debtor that is not guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110207.label: PPG, other private creditors (DOD, current US$)
P110207.description: Public and publicly guaranteed other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110208.label: External debt stocks, long-term private sector (DOD, current US$)
P110208.description: Long-term private sector external debt conveys information about the distribution of long-term debt for DRS countries by type of debtor (private banks and private entities). Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110209.label: PPG, private creditors (DOD, current US$)
P110209.description: Public and publicly guaranteed debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110210.label: External debt stocks, long-term public sector (DOD, current US$)
P110210.description: Long-term public sector external debt conveys information about the distribution of long-term debt for DRS countries by type of debtor (central government, state and local government, central bank, public and mixed enterprises, and official development banks). Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110211.label: Present value of external debt (current US$)
P110211.description: Present value of debt is the sum of short-term external debt plus the discounted sum of total debt service payments due on public, publicly guaranteed, and private nonguaranteed long-term external debt over the life of existing loans. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110212.label: Present value of external debt (% of exports of goods, services and primary income)
P110212.description: Present value of debt is the sum of short-term external debt plus the discounted sum of total debt service payments due on public, publicly guaranteed, and private nonguaranteed long-term external debt over the life of existing loans. The exports denominator is a three-year average.

P110213.label: Present value of external debt (% of GNI)
P110213.description: Present value of debt is the sum of short-term external debt plus the discounted sum of total debt service payments due on public, publicly guaranteed, and private nonguaranteed long-term external debt over the life of existing loans. The GNI denominator is a three-year average.

P110214.label: Residual, debt stock-flow reconciliation (current US$)
P110214.description: The residual difference, i.e. the change in stock not explained by any of the factors identified under debt stock-flow reconciliation, is calculated as the sum of identified accounts minus the change in stock. Where the latter is large it can, in some cases, serve as an illustration of the inconsistencies in the reported data. More often however, it can be explained by specific borrowing phenomenon in individual countries. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110215.label: External debt stocks, variable rate (DOD, current US$)
P110215.description: Variable interest rate is long-term external debt with interest rates that float with movements in a key market rate; for example, the London interbank offered rate (LIBOR) or the U.S. prime rate. This item conveys information about the borrower's exposure to changes in international interest rates. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110216.label: Debt buyback (current US$)
P110216.description: Debt buyback is the repurchase by a debtor of its own debt, discounted or at par. In the event of a buyback of long-term debt, the face value of the debt bought back will be recorded as a decline in the long-term debt stock, and the cash amount received by creditors will be recorded as a principal repayment. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110217.label: Debt stock reduction (current US$)
P110217.description: Debt stock reductions show the amount that has been netted out of the stock of debt using debt conversion schemes such as buybacks and equity swaps or the discounted value of long-term bonds that were issued in exchange for outstanding debt. It includes the effect of any financial operation that will reduce the debt stock other than debt stock restructuring, repayment of principal and debt forgiven. In particular, debt stock reduction will include the face value of debt bought back, the face value of debt swapped for equity (or "nature" or "development"), any face value reduction that might result as the consequence of a bond exchange, and any face value reduction resulting from an exchange of debt for discount bonds. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110218.label: Debt stock rescheduled (current US$)
P110218.description: Debt stocks rescheduled is the amount of debt outstanding rescheduled in any given year. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110219.label: Average grace period on new external debt commitments (years)
P110219.description: Grace period is the period from the date of signature of the loan or the issue of the financial instrument to the first repayment of principal. To obtain the average, the grace periods for all public and publicly guaranteed loans have been weighted by the amounts of the loans. Public debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity.

P110220.label: Average grace period on new external debt commitments, official (years)
P110220.description: Grace period is the period from the date of signature of the loan or the issue of the financial instrument to the first repayment of principal. To obtain the average, the grace periods for all public and publicly guaranteed loans have been weighted by the amounts of the loans. Debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies.

P110221.label: Average grace period on new external debt commitments, private (years)
P110221.description: Grace period is the period from the date of signature of the loan or the issue of the financial instrument to the first repayment of principal. To obtain the average, the grace periods for all public and publicly guaranteed loans have been weighted by the amounts of the loans. Debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency.

P110222.label: Average grant element on new external debt commitments (%)
P110222.description: The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. To obtain the average, the grant elements for all public and publicly guaranteed loans have been weighted by the amounts of the loans. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Commitments cover the total amount of loans for which contracts were signed in the year specified. Public debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Data for private nonguaranteed debt are not available.

P110223.label: Average grant element on new external debt commitments, official (%)
P110223.description: The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. To obtain the average, the grant elements for all public and publicly guaranteed loans have been weighted by the amounts of the loans. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Commitments cover the total amount of loans for which contracts were signed in the year specified. Debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies.

P110224.label: Average grant element on new external debt commitments, private (%)
P110224.description: The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. To obtain the average, the grant elements for all public and publicly guaranteed loans have been weighted by the amounts of the loans. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Commitments cover the total amount of loans for which contracts were signed in the year specified. Debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency.

P110225.label: Average interest on new external debt commitments (%)
P110225.description: Interest represents the average interest rate on all new public and publicly guaranteed loans contracted during the year. To obtain the average, the interest rates for all public and publicly guaranteed loans have been weighted by the amounts of the loans. Public debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity.

P110226.label: Average interest on new external debt commitments, official (%)
P110226.description: Interest represents the average interest rate on all new public and publicly guaranteed loans contracted during the year. To obtain the average, the interest rates for all public and publicly guaranteed loans have been weighted by the amounts of the loans. Debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies.

P110227.label: Average interest on new external debt commitments, private (%)
P110227.description: Interest represents the average interest rate on all new public and publicly guaranteed loans contracted during the year. To obtain the average, the interest rates for all public and publicly guaranteed loans have been weighted by the amounts of the loans. Debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency.

P110228.label: PPG, bilateral (INT, current US$)
P110228.description: Bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Interest payments are actual amounts of interest paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110229.label: PPG, bilateral concessional (INT, current US$)
P110229.description: Bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Interest payments are actual amounts of interest paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110230.label: Interest payments on external debt, total (INT, current US$)
P110230.description: Interest payments are actual amounts of interest paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. This item includes interest paid on long-term debt, IMF charges, and interest paid on short-term debt. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Short-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original maturity of one year or less. Available data permit no distinction between public and private nonguaranteed short-term debt. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110231.label: Interest payments on external debt (% of exports of goods, services and primary income)
P110231.description: Total interest payments to exports of goods, services and primary income. Total interest payment is the sum of interest actually paid in currency, goods, or services on long-term debt, interest paid on short-term debt, and charges to the IMF.

P110232.label: Interest payments on external debt (% of GNI)
P110232.description: Total interest payments to gross national income.

P110233.label: IMF charges (INT, current US$)
P110233.description: IMF charges cover interest payments with respect to all uses of IMF resources, excluding those resulting from drawings in the reserve tranche. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110234.label: Interest payments on external debt, long-term (INT, current US$)
P110234.description: Interest payments on long-term debt are actual amounts of interest paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110235.label: Interest payments on external debt, private nonguaranteed (PNG) (INT, current US$)
P110235.description: Private nonguaranteed external debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is not guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Interest payments are actual amounts of interest paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110236.label: Interest payments on external debt, public and publicly guaranteed (PPG) (INT, current US$)
P110236.description: Public and publicly guaranteed long-term debt are aggregated. Public debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Interest payments are actual amounts of interest paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110237.label: Interest payments on external debt, short-term (INT, current US$)
P110237.description: Interest payments on short-term debt are actual amounts of interest paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. This item includes interest paid on long-term debt, IMF charges, and interest paid on short-term debt. Short-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original maturity of one year or less. Available data permit no distinction between public and private nonguaranteed short-term debt. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110238.label: PPG, IBRD (INT, current US$)
P110238.description: Public and publicly guaranteed debt outstanding from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) is nonconcessional. Nonconcessional debt excludes loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. Interest payments are actual amounts of interest paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110239.label: PPG, IDA (INT, current US$)
P110239.description: Public and publicly guaranteed debt outstanding from the International Development Association (IDA) is concessional. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Interest payments are actual amounts of interest paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P110240.label: PPG, multilateral (INT, current US$)
P110240.description: Public and publicly guaranteed multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Interest payments are actual amounts of interest paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

P3020.label: residence time of water
P3020.description: residence time of water in a lake or sea

P3036.label: precipitation height
P3036.description: maximum height of snow or rain during an event or space of time

P3039.label: wheelbase
P3039.description: distance between centers of front wheel and rear wheel

P3041.label: luminous intensity
P3041.description: measure of the emitted light intensity

P3063.label: gestation period
P3063.description: amount of time needed for gestation for this animal taxon

P3071.label: standard molar entropy
P3071.description: entropy content of one mole of substance under standard conditions (25°C, 1 bar)

P3078.label: standard enthalpy of formation
P3078.description: change of enthalpy during the formation of 1 mole of the compound from its constituent elements, with all substances in their standard states at 1 bar and 25°C

P3086.label: speed limit
P3086.description: maximum speed allowed on a transport route or in a certain area

P3087.label: fiscal/tax revenue
P3087.description: fiscal revenue of a public entity

P3157.label: event distance
P3157.description: distance over which a race or other event is conducted or was achieved

P3251.label: minimum viable temperature
P3251.description: lowest operating temperature where the culturing of micro-organisms and/or enzyme activity occurs

P3252.label: maximum viable temperature
P3252.description: highest operating temperature where the culturing of micro-organisms and/or enzyme activity occurs

P3253.label: optimum viable temperature
P3253.description: the operating temperature where the culturing of micro-organisms and/or enzyme activity thrives best

P3260.label: points awarded
P3260.description: points awarded to the winning person or team for a win, draw, tie or loss. If no points are awarded for some category of finish (e.g. loss) use value 0 not ''no value''.

P3270.label: compulsory education (minimum age)
P3270.description: minimum age for children when compulsory education starts. Qualifiers: "subject of" to link to more detail. If applicable, use qualifier P31 with value "varies by state/province" (Q27145860). Use "start time" or "point in time" for historic data.

P3271.label: compulsory education (maximum age)
P3271.description: maximum age for children when compulsory education ends. Qualifiers: "subject of" to link to more detail. If applicable, use qualifier P31 with value "varies by state/province" (Q27145860). Use "start time" or "point in time" for historic data.

P3337.label: generation time
P3337.description: average time from one generation to another within the same population

P3387.label: minimum frequency of audible sound
P3387.description: minimum frequency of audible sound for this species

P3395.label: heart rate
P3395.description: speed of the heartbeat measured by the number of contractions of the heart per minute (bpm)

P3439.label: angular resolution
P3439.description: angular resolution of an optical instrument

P3457.label: case fatality rate
P3457.description: proportion of patients who die of a particular medical condition out of all who have this condition within a given time frame

P3465.label: maximum frequency of audible sound
P3465.description: maximum frequency of audible sound for this species

P3485.label: bite force quotient
P3485.description: regression of the quotient of an animal's bite force in newtons divided by its body mass in kilogrammes

P3486.label: normal respiratory rate
P3486.description: normal number of respiratory cycles (inspiration and exhalation) per minute, measured in an individual

P3487.label: maximal incubation period in humans
P3487.description: maximal time between an infection and the onset of disease symptoms in infected humans

P3488.label: minimal incubation period in humans
P3488.description: minimal time between an infection and the onset of disease symptoms in infected humans

P3492.label: basic reproduction number
P3492.description: number of infections caused by one infection within an uninfected population

P3530.label: par
P3530.description: predetermined number of strokes a 0-handicap golfer should require to complete a hole, a round or a tournament

P3575.label: data size
P3575.description: size of software, dataset, or an individual file

P3618.label: base salary
P3618.description: gross salary of a position or a person (not including bonuses or other forms of remuneration)

P3629.label: stated age at event
P3629.description: the age of the subject according to the cited source at the time of an event. Used as a qualifier of significant event property

P3737.label: maximum wavelength of sensitivity
P3737.description: maximum wavelength that the item can detect

P3738.label: minimum wavelength of sensitivity
P3738.description: minimum wavelength that the item can detect

P3740.label: number of works
P3740.description: qualifier on identifiers, eg for creators or locations, giving the number of works in the external database associated with the subject of the identifier

P3744.label: number of subscribers
P3744.description: number of subscribers for subscription based companies, e.g. telecommunication companies, newspapers, pay-TV channels, etc.

P3792.label: rate of fire
P3792.description: the frequency at which a specific weapon can fire or launch its projectiles

P3840.label: slope rating
P3840.description: the slope rating of a golf course is a measure of its difficulty for bogey golfers

P3864.label: suicide rate
P3864.description: amount of suicides per 100,000 people in the place or group

P3872.label: patronage
P3872.description: number of passengers, patrons or visitors in specified time period

P3886.label: number of perpetrators
P3886.description: number of perpetrators in an event, as reported by reliable sources

P3891.label: observing time available
P3891.description: amount of observing time available at a telescope (or other instrument)

P3917.label: IPA number order
P3917.description: the IPA order number of an IPA phoneme

P3934.label: face value
P3934.description: value printed on a coin, stamp or banknote by the issuing authority

P3983.label: sports league level
P3983.description: the level of the sport league in the sport league system

P4010.label: GDP (PPP)
P4010.description: gross domestic product (GDP) at purchasing power parity (current international $)

P4036.label: field of view
P4036.description: extent of the observable world that can be seen or sensed by the item

P4080.label: number of houses
P4080.description: number of houses in given territorial entity

P4103.label: assets under management
P4103.description: total market value of financial assets which a financial institution manages on behalf of its clients and itself

P4105.label: EGF rating
P4105.description: rating given by EGF (European Go Federation) to European go players

P4131.label: annual energy output
P4131.description: annual energy output of a power plant

P4135.label: maximum age
P4135.description: highest age a person is eligible to do something, for example be member in youth organisation or sport teams, or for some positions like judges

P4137.label: muzzle velocity
P4137.description: speed of a projectile at the moment it leaves the muzzle of a gun

P4140.label: energy storage capacity
P4140.description: storage capacity of a battery or energy storage system

P4153.label: offset
P4153.description: qualifier of "magic number" for the number of bytes before the magic number to be searched in a file

P4176.label: effective firing range
P4176.description: distance within which a weapon can be used effectively

P4183.label: angle from vertical
P4183.description: angle the principal axis of an item makes with the vertical; use degree (Q28390) as unit

P4184.label: slope
P4184.description: angle the surface of an item makes with the horizontal

P4214.label: highest observed lifespan
P4214.description: age of the oldest specimen of a taxon for which the age can be verified

P4218.label: shelf life
P4218.description: length of time that a commodity may be stored without becoming unfit for use or consumption

P4242.label: maximal rate of climb
P4242.description: maximum rate of positive altitude change with respect to time for an aircraft

P4250.label: defined daily dose
P4250.description: average maintenance dose per day for a medicine used for its main indication in adults

P4253.label: number of constituencies
P4253.description: number of constituencies related to a legislative body

P4268.label: half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50)
P4268.description: measure of the effectiveness of a substance in inhibiting a specific biological or biochemical function

P4269.label: half maximal effective concentration
P4269.description: concentration of a drug, antibody or toxicant which induces a response halfway between the baseline and maximum after a specified exposure time

P4295.label: readership
P4295.description: average number of readers of a newspaper or other periodical, per issue

P4341.label: synodic period
P4341.description: time between two passes of an object in front of a distant star seen from another orbiting object

P4350.label: salinity
P4350.description: amount of dissolved salt in a body of water

P4403.label: caliber
P4403.description: inner diameter of the gun barrel for a weapon

P4441.label: hydraulic head
P4441.description: hydraulic head of a dam or hydroelectric power station

P4442.label: mean age
P4442.description: mean age in a given place; qualify with P585

P4445.label: grace period
P4445.description: period immediately after the deadline for an obligation during which a fee is waived

P4447.label: minimum spend bonus
P4447.description: reward for spending a sum of money

P4448.label: cash back
P4448.description: Cash or Points received for spending money as part of a loyalty program

P4500.label: family relationship degree
P4500.description: kinship degree, degree of consanguinity, generation of people with this kinship type when clearly identifiable.

P4501.label: albedo
P4501.description: ratio of reflected radiation to incident radiation

P4511.label: vertical depth
P4511.description: vertical distance from a horizontal area to a point below. Compare with "horizontal depth" (P5524)

P4519.label: payload mass
P4519.description: amount of mass that can be transported by the vehicle

P4714.label: title page number
P4714.description: qualifier to indicate the number of the page of a document in which the title page is located. Don't use for the actual cover page.

P4841.label: total fertility rate
P4841.description: average number of children that would be born to a woman over her lifetime

P4851.label: maximum food additive use level
P4851.description: maximum allowed level of food additive permitted in a quantity of food

P4876.label: number of records
P4876.description: number of values of an identifier or records in a catalog

P4895.label: time index
P4895.description: indicate when something happens relative to its beginning

P4909.label: number of players in region
P4909.description: number of registered players in a sport or people practicing a sport in a region

P4912.label: century breaks
P4912.description: in snooker, the number of career century breaks at officіal professional tournaments

P4999.label: number of clubs
P4999.description: number of clubs active in a given sport for a region

P5022.label: test score
P5022.description: score that the item achieved in a test; use as qualifier for "test taken" (P5021)

P5027.label: number of representations
P5027.description: number of shows (including the premiere) of a concert tour or a performing arts production

P5043.label: number of abstentions
P5043.description: number of abstentions in a voting round of a election

P5044.label: number of spoilt votes
P5044.description: number of spoilt votes in a voting round for a specfic position in a election

P5045.label: number of blank votes
P5045.description: number of blank votes in a voting round for a specific position in a election

P5065.label: wind speed
P5065.description: wind flow velocity recorded during a given moment or period of time

P5066.label: operating temperature
P5066.description: temperature at which a device operates. Use qualifier "criterion used" (P1013) and values such as "maximum" (Q10578722), "minimum" (Q10585806), etc.

P5067.label: non-operating temperature
P5067.description: temperature that a device can bear when it's turned off

P5069.label: service life
P5069.description: product's total life in use from the point of sale to the point of discard

P5071.label: boiler pressure
P5071.description: pressure at which a steam boiler operates. Use P1013 as qualifier to indicate if it is maximum pressure.

P5141.label: coastline
P5141.description: length of the coastline (sea shore) of the region. Use qualifier "determination method" (P459) to define how it's determined/which granularity is used.

P5167.label: vehicles per thousand people
P5167.description: number of vehicles per 1000 people. Use qualifier determination method (P459) to describe how it's done.

P5205.label: stroke count
P5205.description: number of strokes in a Chinese, Japanese, Korean or Vietnamese character

P5230.label: chromosome count
P5230.description: karyological information on the number of chromosomes typical for a species

P5281.label: residual stroke count
P5281.description: (qualifier) number of residual stroke in addition to radical of Chinese character

P5348.label: angular diameter
P5348.description: angular measurement describing how large a sphere or circle appears from a given point of view

P5349.label: laps completed
P5349.description: number of laps completed by a race participant

P5427.label: position of accent nucleus
P5427.description: (qualifier) position of the accented mora in Japanese

P5428.label: position of devoiced vowel
P5428.description: (qualifier) position of kana with devoiced vowel

P5436.label: number of viewers/listeners
P5436.description: number of viewers of a television or broadcasting program; web traffic on websites

P5447.label: lower limit
P5447.description: lower limit of a range or an interval; (qualifier) used with a dummy value which specifies the type of the range or interval

P5448.label: upper limit
P5448.description: upper limit of a range or an interval; (qualifier) used with a dummy value which specifies the type of the range or interval

P5474.label: section number
P5474.description: number assigned to a section of sportspeople in a sporting competition; e.g. "2" for a "semi-final 2"; use together with property "stage reached" (P2443)

P5479.label: ultimate tensile strength
P5479.description: material property measuring the tensil strengh at break

P5480.label: tensile modulus of elasticity
P5480.description: material proprety linking the elastic deformation to the yield strengh.

P5481.label: position of nasal sonant
